segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 3
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 3

segments.pli: 13. Kusināravagga
segments.en: 13. Kusināra

segments.pli: 126. Bharaṇḍukālāmasutta
segments.en: 126. Bharaṇḍu Kālāma

segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā kosalesu cārikaṃ caramāno yena kapilavatthu tadavasari.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was wandering in the land of the Kosalans when he arrived at Kapilavatthu.

segments.pli: Assosi kho mahānāmo sakko: “bhagavā kira kapilavatthuṃ anuppatto”ti.
segments.en: Mahānāma the Sakyan heard that he had arrived.

segments.pli: Atha kho mahānāmo sakko yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ aṭṭhāsi. Ekamantaṃ ṭhitaṃ kho mahānāmaṃ sakkaṃ bhagavā etadavoca:
segments.en: He went up to the Buddha, bowed, and stood to one side. The Buddha said to him,

segments.pli: “Gaccha, mahānāma, kapilavatthusmiṃ, tathārūpaṃ āvasathaṃ jāna yatthajja mayaṃ ekarattiṃ vihareyyāmā”ti.
segments.en: “Go into Kapilavatthu, Mahānāma, and check if there’s a suitable guest house where I can spend the night.”

segments.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”ti kho mahānāmo sakko bhagavato paṭissutvā kapilavatthuṃ pavisitvā kevalakappaṃ kapilavatthuṃ anvāhiṇḍanto nāddasa kapilavatthusmiṃ tathārūpaṃ āvasathaṃ yatthajja bhagavā ekarattiṃ vihareyya.
segments.en: “Yes, sir,” replied Mahānāma. He returned to Kapilavatthu and searched all over the city, but he couldn’t see a suitable guest house for the Buddha to spend the night.

segments.pli: Atha kho mahānāmo sakko yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Then Mahānāma went up to the Buddha, and said to him,

segments.pli: “natthi, bhante, kapilavatthusmiṃ tathārūpo āvasatho yatthajja bhagavā ekarattiṃ vihareyya.
segments.en: “Sir, there’s no suitable guest house in Kapilavatthu for you to spend the night.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ, bhante, bharaṇḍu kālāmo bhagavato purāṇasabrahmacārī.
segments.en: But there is this Bharaṇḍu the Kālāma, who used to be the Buddha’s spiritual companion.

segments.pli: Tassajja bhagavā assame ekarattiṃ viharatū”ti.
segments.en: Why don’t you spend the night at his hermitage?”

segments.pli: “Gaccha, mahānāma, santharaṃ paññāpehī”ti.
segments.en: “Go, Mahānāma, and set out a mat.”

segments.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”ti kho mahānāmo sakko bhagavato paṭissutvā yena bharaṇḍussa kālāmassa assamo tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā santharaṃ paññāpetvā udakaṃ ṭhapetvā pādānaṃ dhovanāya yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: “Yes, sir,” replied Mahānāma. He went to Bharaṇḍu’s hermitage, where he set out a mat, and got foot-washing water ready. Then he went back to the Buddha and said to him,

segments.pli: “santhato, bhante, santhāro, udakaṃ ṭhapitaṃ pādānaṃ dhovanāya.
segments.en: “The mat and foot-washing water are set out.

segments.pli: Yassadāni, bhante, bhagavā kālaṃ maññatī”ti.
segments.en: Please, sir, go at your convenience.”

segments.pli: Atha kho bhagavā yena bharaṇḍussa kālāmassa assamo tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi.
segments.en: Then the Buddha went to Bharaṇḍu’s hermitage, sat down on the seat spread out,

segments.pli: Nisajja kho bhagavā pāde pakkhālesi.
segments.en: and washed his feet.

segments.pli: Atha kho mahānāmassa sakkassa etadahosi:
segments.en: Then it occurred to Mahānāma,

segments.pli: “akālo kho ajja bhagavantaṃ payirupāsituṃ.
segments.en: “It’s too late to pay homage to the Buddha today.

segments.pli: Kilanto bhagavā.
segments.en: He’s tired.

segments.pli: Sve dānāhaṃ bhagavantaṃ payirupāsissāmī”ti bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā pakkāmi.
segments.en: Tomorrow I’ll pay homage to the Buddha.” He bowed to the Buddha and respectfully circled him, keeping him on his right, then he left.

segments.pli: Atha kho mahānāmo sakko tassā rattiyā accayena yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinnaṃ kho mahānāmaṃ sakkaṃ bhagavā etadavoca:
segments.en: Then, when the night had passed, Mahānāma the Sakyan went up to the Buddha, and sat down to one side. The Buddha said to him:

segments.pli: “tayo khome, mahānāma, satthāro santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmiṃ.
segments.en: “Mahānāma, there are these three teachers found in the world.

segments.pli: Katame tayo?
segments.en: What three?

segments.pli: Idha, mahānāma, ekacco satthā kāmānaṃ pariññaṃ paññāpeti;
segments.en: One teacher advocates the complete understanding of sensual pleasures,

segments.pli: na rūpānaṃ pariññaṃ paññāpeti, na vedanānaṃ pariññaṃ paññāpeti.
segments.en: but not of sights or feelings.

segments.pli: Idha pana, mahānāma, ekacco satthā kāmānaṃ pariññaṃ paññāpeti, rūpānaṃ pariññaṃ paññāpeti;
segments.en: One teacher advocates the complete understanding of sensual pleasures and sights,

segments.pli: na vedanānaṃ pariññaṃ paññāpeti.
segments.en: but not of feelings.

segments.pli: Idha pana, mahānāma, ekacco satthā kāmānaṃ pariññaṃ paññāpeti, rūpānaṃ pariññaṃ paññāpeti, vedanānaṃ pariññaṃ paññāpeti.
segments.en: One teacher advocates the complete understanding of sensual pleasures, sights, and feelings.

segments.pli: Ime kho, mahānāma, tayo satthāro santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmiṃ.
segments.en: These are the three teachers found in the world.

segments.pli: Imesaṃ, mahānāma, tiṇṇaṃ satthārānaṃ ekā niṭṭhā udāhu puthu niṭṭhā”ti?
segments.en: Do these three teachers have the same goal or different goals?”

segments.pli: Evaṃ vutte, bharaṇḍu kālāmo mahānāmaṃ sakkaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: When he said this, Bharaṇḍu said to Mahānāma,

segments.pli: “ekāti, mahānāma, vadehī”ti.
segments.en: “Say they’re the same, Mahānāma!”

segments.pli: Evaṃ vutte, bhagavā mahānāmaṃ sakkaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: The Buddha said,

segments.pli: “nānāti, mahānāma, vadehī”ti.
segments.en: “Say they’re different, Mahānāma!”

segments.pli: Dutiyampi kho bharaṇḍu kālāmo mahānāmaṃ sakkaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: For a second time, Bharaṇḍu said,

segments.pli: “ekāti, mahānāma, vadehī”ti.
segments.en: “Say they’re the same, Mahānāma!”

segments.pli: Dutiyampi kho bhagavā mahānāmaṃ sakkaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: The Buddha said,

segments.pli: “nānāti, mahānāma, vadehī”ti.
segments.en: “Say they’re different, Mahānāma!”

segments.pli: Tatiyampi kho bharaṇḍu kālāmo mahānāmaṃ sakkaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: For a third time, Bharaṇḍu said,

segments.pli: “ekāti, mahānāma, vadehī”ti.
segments.en: “Say they’re the same, Mahānāma!”

segments.pli: Tatiyampi kho bhagavā mahānāmaṃ sakkaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: The Buddha said,

segments.pli: “nānāti, mahānāma, vadehī”ti.
segments.en: “Say they’re different, Mahānāma!”

segments.pli: Atha kho bharaṇḍu kālāmassa etadahosi:
segments.en: Then it occurred to Bharaṇḍu,

segments.pli: “mahesakkhassa vatamhi mahānāmassa sakkassa sammukhā samaṇena gotamena yāvatatiyaṃ apasādito.
segments.en: “The Buddha has rebuked me three times in front of this illustrious Mahānāma.

segments.pli: Yannūnāhaṃ kapilavatthumhā pakkameyyan”ti.
segments.en: Why don’t I leave Kapilavatthu?”

segments.pli: Atha kho bharaṇḍu kālāmo kapilavatthumhā pakkāmi.
segments.en: Then Bharaṇḍu the Kālāma left Kapilavatthu,

segments.pli: Yaṃ kapilavatthumhā pakkāmi tathā pakkantova ahosi na puna paccāgacchīti.
segments.en: never to return.

segments.pli: Catutthaṃ.

suttaplex.blurb: The Buddha discusses different kinds of teachers while staying at a hermitage near his home town of Kapilavatthu.
